original: 7. Saddhammantaradhānapañha
translated: The Questions about the Disappearance of the True Dhamma

original: “Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ bhagavatā—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhāsitam petam bhagavatā
translated: “‘Venerable Nāgasena, this too was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘pañceva dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassatī’ti.
analyzed: pañca iva dāni ānanda vassa satāni saddhammo ṭhassati iti
translated: “‘Ānanda, from now on the true Dhamma will last for only five hundred years.”

original: Puna ca parinibbānasamaye subhaddena paribbājakena pañhaṁ puṭṭhena bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: puna ca parinibbāna samaye subhaddena paribbājakena pañham puṭṭhena bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: But again, when he was asked a question by the wanderer Subhadda at the time of his final Nibbāna, the Blessed One said:

original: ‘ime ca, subhadda, bhikkhū sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assā’ti, asesavacanametaṁ, nissesavacanametaṁ, nippariyāyavacanametaṁ.
analyzed: ime ca subhadda bhikkhū sammā vihareyyu asuññaḥ lokaḥ arahantehi assa ati asesa vacanam eta nissesa vacanam eta nippariyāya vacanam eta
translated: “‘Subhadda, if these monks live rightly, the world will not be void of arahats.” This is a statement that is absolute, unconditional, final.

original: Yadi, bhante nāgasena, tathāgatena bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena tathāgatena bhaṇita
translated: If the Tathāgata said:

original: ‘pañceva dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassatī’ti, tena hi ‘asuñño loko arahantehi assā’ti yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: pañca iva dāni ānanda vassa satāni saddhammo ṭhassati iti tena hi asuññaḥ loko arahantehi yam tam micchā
translated: ‘Ānanda, from now on the true Dhamma will last for only five hundred years,’ then the statement ‘the world will not be void of arahats’ must be wrong.

original: Yadi tathāgatena bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yadi tathāgatena bhaṇita
translated: If the Tathāgata said:

original: ‘asuñño loko arahantehi assā’ti, tena hi ‘pañceva dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassatī’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: asuññaḥ lokaḥ arahantehi assa ati tena hi pañca iva dāni ānanda vassa satāni saddhammo ti tat pi vacanam micchā
translated: ‘The world is not empty of arahats,’ then you should abandon that statement.

original: Ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho gahanatopi gahanataro balavatopi balavataro gaṇṭhitopi
analyzed: ayam pi ubhatas koṭikaḥ pañhaḥ gahanataḥ pi gahanataraḥ balavataḥ pi balavataraḥ gaṇṭhitaḥ api
translated: This is a double-pronged question, more knotty, more intricate, more elusive, more subtle, harder to solve than the one you asked me before.

original: gaṇṭhitaro, so tavānuppatto, tattha te ñāṇabalavipphāraṁ dassehi makaro viya sāgarabbhantaragato”ti.
analyzed: gaṇṭhitaraḥ saḥ tava anuppattaḥ tattha te ñāṇa bala vipphāram dassehi makaraḥ viya sāgara bbhantara gataḥ ti
translated: It is a question about the ocean, and you have come to me as a shark in the ocean.

original: “Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā ‘pañceva dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassatī’ti.
analyzed: bhāsitam peta mahā rāja bhagavatā pañca iva dāni ānanda vassa satāni saddhammo ṭhassati iti
translated: “‘The world will last for five hundred years,’ this was said by the Lord.

original: Parinibbānasamaye ca subhaddassa paribbājakassa bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: parinibbāna samaye ca subhaddassa paribbājakassa
translated: And at the time of his Parinibbana he said to Subhadda:

original: ‘ime ca, subhadda, bhikkhū sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assā’ti.
analyzed: ime ca subhadda bhikkhū sammā vihareyyu asuññaḥ lokaḥ arahantehi assa ati
translated: ‘If these bhikkhus lead the holy life rightly, the world will not be lacking in arahats.’

original: Tañca pana, mahārāja, bhagavato vacanaṁ nānatthañceva hoti nānābyañjanañca, ayaṁ sāsanaparicchedo, ayaṁ paṭipatti paridīpanāti dūraṁ vivajjitā te ubho aññamaññaṁ.
analyzed: tat ca pana mahā rāja bhagavataḥ vacanam nānattham ca iva hoti nānā byañjanam ca ayam sāsana paricchedaḥ ayam paṭipatti paridīpanā ati dūram vivajjitā te ubho aññamañña
translated: But, sire, the words of the Blessed One have a different meaning and a different phrasing. This is the section on the Dispensation, this is the section on the teaching of the practice. The two are far apart and do not touch each other.

original: Yathā, mahārāja, nabhaṁ pathavito dūraṁ vivajjitaṁ, nirayaṁ saggato dūraṁ vivajjitaṁ, kusalaṁ akusalato dūraṁ vivajjitaṁ, sukhaṁ dukkhato dūraṁ vivajjitaṁ;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja nabham pathavitaḥ dūram vivajjita nirayam saggataḥ dūram vivajjita kusalam akusalataḥ dūram vivajjita sukham dukkhataḥ dūram vivajjita
translated: As, sire, the sky is far removed from the earth, as hell is far removed from heaven, as the wholesome is far removed from the unwholesome, as pleasure is far removed from pain,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, te ubho aññamaññaṁ dūraṁ vivajjitā.🔽Api ca, mahārāja, mā te pucchā moghā assa, rasato te saṁsanditvā kathayissāmi ‘pañceva
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja te ubho aññam aññam dūram vivajjitā  api ca mahā rāja mā te pucchā moghā assa rasataḥ te sasanditvā kathayissāmi pañca iva
translated: even so, sire, are these two far removed from each other.

original: dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassatī’ti yaṁ bhagavā āha, taṁ khayaṁ paridīpayanto
analyzed: dāni ānanda vassa satāni saddhammo ṭhassati iti yam bhagavā āha tam khayam paridīpayantaḥ
translated: “But, sire, let not your question be in vain. I will explain to you in brief. The Blessed One said: ‘Ānanda, now the true Dhamma will last only five hundred years.’ What he was pointing out by this was the decay of the Dhamma.

original: sesakaṁ paricchindi, ‘vassasahassaṁ, ānanda, saddhammo tiṭṭheyya, sace bhikkhuniyo na pabbājeyyuṁ.
analyzed: sesakam paricchindi vassa sahasse ānanda saddhammaḥ tiṭṭheyya sace bhikkhuniyo na pabbājeyyu
translated: He was cutting down the remainder, saying: ‘Ānanda, if the bhikkhunīs had not been ordained, the true Dhamma would have lasted a thousand years.

original: Pañceva dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassatī’ti.
analyzed: pañca iva dāni ānanda vassa satāni saddhammo ṭhassati iti
translated: Now the true Dhamma will last only five hundred years.’

original: Api nu kho, mahārāja, bhagavā evaṁ vadanto saddhammassa antaradhānaṁ vā vadeti abhisamayaṁ vā paṭikkosatī”ti?
analyzed: api nu kho mahā rāja bhagavā evam vadantaḥ saddhammassa antaradhānam vā vadeti abhisamayam vā paṭikkosati iti
translated: Now, sire, did the Blessed One, in saying this, declare the disappearance of the true Dhamma or did he deny the realization of it?”

original: “Na hi, bhante”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhantā iti
translated: “No, revered sir.”

original: “Naṭṭhaṁ, mahārāja, parikittayanto sesakaṁ paridīpayanto paricchindi.
analyzed: naṭṭha mahā rāja parikittayanto sesakam paridīpayanto paricchindi
translated: “He was pointing out what was lost, Your Majesty, and was indicating what remained.

original: Yathā, mahārāja, puriso naṭṭhāyiko sabbasesakaṁ gahetvā janassa paridīpeyya ‘ettakaṁ me bhaṇḍaṁ naṭṭhaṁ, idaṁ sesakan’ti.
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja purisaḥ na ṭṭhāyikaḥ sabbasesakam gahetvā janassa paridīpeyya ettakam me bhaṇḍam naṭṭhe idam sesakanti
translated: It is as if a man who had lost something were to go around showing it to people, saying: ‘I have lost this, this is what remains.’

original: Evameva kho, mahārāja, bhagavā naṭṭhaṁ paridīpayanto sesakaṁ devamanussānaṁ kathesi ‘pañceva dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassatī’ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja bhagavā naṭṭham paridīpayantaḥ sesakam deva manussānam kathesi pañca iva dāni ānanda vassa satāni saddhammo ṭhassati iti
translated: In the same way, Your Majesty, the Blessed One was pointing out what was lost and was speaking about what remained for gods and men: ‘Now, Ananda, the True Dhamma will last only five hundred years.’

original: Yaṁ pana, mahārāja, bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yam pana mahā rāja bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: But, Your Majesty, what was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘pañceva dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassatī’ti, sāsanaparicchedo eso.
analyzed: pañca iva dāni ānanda vassa satāni saddhammo ṭhassati iti sāsana paricchedaḥ eso
translated: ‘Now, Ananda, the True Dhamma will last only five hundred years’—this is a limitation of the Dispensation.

original: Yaṁ pana parinibbānasamaye subhaddassa paribbājakassa samaṇe parikittayanto āha—
analyzed: yam pana parinibbāna samaye subhaddassa paribbājakassa samaṇe parikittayantaḥ āha
translated: But when, at the time of his final Nibbana, he was pointing out the monks to the wanderer Subhadda, saying:

original: ‘ime ca, subhadda, bhikkhū sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assā’ti, paṭipattiparidīpanā esā, tvaṁ pana taṁ paricchedañca paridīpanañca ekarasaṁ karosi.
analyzed: ime ca subhadda bhikkhū sammā vihareyyu asuññaḥ lokaḥ arahantehi assa ati paṭipatti paridīpanā esā tvam pana tam paricchedam ca paridīpanañca ekarasam karosi
translated: ‘If, Subhadda, these monks were to conduct themselves properly, the world would not be left without arahants,’ this was an indication of the practice. But you make that limitation and that indication one and the same thing.

original: Yadi pana te chando, ekarasaṁ katvā kathayissāmi, sādhukaṁ suṇohi manasikarohi avikkhittamānaso.
analyzed: yadi pana te chandaḥ eka rasam katvā kathayissāmi sādhukam suṇohi manasikarohi a vikkhitta mānasaḥ
translated: But if you wish, I will tell you, having made it one-flavoured. Listen well and pay attention, with one-pointed mind.

original: Idha, mahārāja, taḷāko bhaveyya navasalilasampuṇṇo sammukhamuttariyamāno paricchinno
analyzed: idha mahā rāja taḷākaḥ bhaveyya nava salila sampuṇṇaḥ sammukham uttariyamānaḥ paricchinnaḥ
translated: Here, Great King, suppose there were a lake full of clear water, with a bank all around,

original: parivaṭumakato, apariyādiṇṇeyeva tasmiṁ taḷāke udakūpari mahāmegho aparāparaṁ anuppabandho
analyzed: tasmin taḷāke udaka upari mahā meghaḥ apara aparam
translated: and a great rain fell on that lake, and the water in the lake was not taken away, nor did it evaporate,

original: abhivasseyya, api nu kho, mahārāja, tasmiṁ taḷāke udakaṁ parikkhayaṁ pariyādānaṁ gaccheyyā”ti?
analyzed: abhivasseyya api nu kho mahā rāja tasmin taḷāke udakam parikkhayam pariyādānam gaccheyya ati
translated: would the water in that lake, Great King, come to an end and be exhausted?”

original: “Na hi, bhante”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhantā iti
translated: “No, venerable sir.”

original: “Kena kāraṇena, mahārājā”ti?
analyzed: kena kāraṇena mahā rājā ati
translated: “For what reason, Great King?”

original: “Meghassa, bhante, anuppabandhatāyā”ti.
analyzed: meghassa bhante an uppabandha tāya ati
translated: “Because of the continuous rain, venerable sir.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, jinasāsanavarasaddhammataḷāko ācārasīlaguṇavattapaṭipattivimalanavasalilasampuṇṇo uttariyamāno bhavaggamabhibhavitvā ṭhito.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja jina sāsana vara saddhamma taḷākaḥ ācāra sīla guṇavatta paṭipatti vimala nava salila sampuṇṇaḥ uttariyamānaḥ bhavaggam abhibhavitvā ṭhitaḥ
translated: “Just so, Great King, the lake of the excellent true Dhamma of the Jina’s Dispensation, full of the clear water of the practice of virtue, moral conduct, and good habits, having overcome the peak of existence, stands out.

original: Yadi tattha buddhaputtā ācārasīlaguṇavattapaṭipattimeghavassaṁ aparāparaṁ anuppabandhāpeyyuṁ abhivassāpeyyuṁ.🔽Evamidaṁ jinasāsanavarasaddhammataḷāko ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭheyya, arahantehi🔽loko asuñño bhaveyya, imamatthaṁ bhagavatā sandhāya bhāsitaṁ ‘ime ca, subhadda, bhikkhū
analyzed: yadi tattha buddha puttāḥ ācāra sīla guṇavatta paṭipatti megha vassam apara aparam an uppabandhāpeyyum abhivassāpeyyu  evam idam jina sāsana vara saddhamma taḷāko ciram dīgham addhānam tiṭṭheyya arahantehi  lokaḥ asuññaḥ bhaveyya imam attham bhagavatā sandhāya bhāsitam ime ca subhadda bhikkhū
translated: If the sons of the Buddha were to cause a succession of showers of the rain of virtue, of good conduct, of the habit of doing what is right, to fall on it,

original: sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assā’ti.
analyzed: sammā vihareyyu asuññaḥ lokaḥ arahantehi assa āti
translated: then the good Dhamma, the excellent Jina’s Dispensation, would last long. The world would not be empty of Arahants. With reference to this matter the Blessed One said: ‘If, Subhadda, these bhikkhus were to live rightly, the world would not be empty of Arahants.’

original: Idha pana, mahārāja, mahati mahāaggikkhandhe jalamāne aparāparaṁ sukkhatiṇakaṭṭhagomayāni upasaṁhareyyuṁ, api nu kho so, mahārāja, aggikkhandho nibbāyeyyā”ti?
analyzed: idha pana mahā rāja mahati mahā aggi khandhe jalamāne apara aparam sukkha tiṇa kaṭṭha gomayāni upasahareyyu api nu kho saḥ mahā rāja aggi khandhaḥ nibbāyeyya ati
translated: Now, sire, if one were to bring dry grass, sticks, cow-dung and wood to a great blazing bonfire and add them to it, would that fire go out?”

original: “Na hi, bhante, bhiyyo bhiyyo so aggikkhandho jaleyya, bhiyyo bhiyyo pabhāseyyā”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhante bhiyyaḥ bhiyyaḥ saḥ aggi kkhandhaḥ jaleyya bhiyyaḥ bhiyyaḥ pabhāseyya ati
translated: “No, revered sir, it would burn more fiercely and blaze up more than before.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, dasasahassiyā lokadhātuyā jinasāsanavarampi ācārasīlaguṇavattapaṭipattiyā jalati pabhāsati.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja dasa sahassiyā lokadhātuyā jina sāsana varam pi ācāra sīla guṇavatta paṭipattiyā jalati pabhāsati
translated: “Even so, sire, the excellent Jina’s Dispensation blazes up in the ten-thousandfold world system with the rain of virtue, good conduct, the habit of doing what is right and the practice of the right way.

original: Yadi pana, mahārāja, taduttariṁ buddhaputtā pañcahi padhāniyaṅgehi samannāgatā satatamappamattā
analyzed: yadi pana mahā rāja tad uttarim buddha puttā pañcahi padhāniyaṅgehi samannāgatā satatam appamattā
translated: But if, sire, the sons of the Buddha, endowed with the five factors of striving, were to strive constantly and earnestly,

original: padaheyyuṁ, tīsu sikkhāsu chandajātā sikkheyyuṁ, cārittañca sīlaṁ samattaṁ paripūreyyuṁ,🔽evamidaṁ jinasāsanavaraṁ bhiyyo bhiyyo ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭheyya, asuñño loko
analyzed: padaheyyu tīsu sikkhāsu chanda jātā sikkheyyu cārittam ca sīlam samattam paripūreyyu  evam idam jina sāsana varam bhiyyas bhiyyas ciram dīgham addhānam tiṭṭheyya asuññaḥ loko
translated: and were to train in the three trainings with a will to do, and were to fulfil the virtue of conduct in its entirety,

original: arahantehi assāti imamatthaṁ bhagavatā sandhāya bhāsitaṁ ‘ime ca, subhadda, bhikkhū
analyzed: arahantehi assa ati imam attham bhagavatā sandhāya bhāsitam ime ca subhadda bhikkhū
translated: then this excellent Dispensation of the Conqueror would last for a very long time, and the world would not be empty of Arahants. This is the meaning the Blessed One had in mind when he said: ‘If these bhikkhus, Subhadda,

original: sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assā’ti.
analyzed: sammā vihareyyu asuññaḥ lokaḥ arahantehi assa āti
translated: were to conduct themselves properly, the world would not be empty of Arahants.’

original: Idha pana, mahārāja, siniddhasamasumajjitasappabhāsavimalādāsaṁ saṇhasukhumagerukacuṇṇena aparāparaṁ majjeyyuṁ, api nu kho, mahārāja, tasmiṁ ādāse malakaddamarajojallaṁ jāyeyyā”ti?
analyzed: idha pana mahā rāja siniddha sama su majjita sappa bhāsa vimalā dāsam saṇha su khuma geruka cuṇṇena apara aparam majjeyyu api nu khalu mahā rāja tasmin ādāse mala kaddama rajaḥ jallam jāyeyya ati
translated: But if, sire, they were to polish over and over again that mirror, which is smooth, even, well polished, clear and bright, with fine soft powder of precious stones, would dust, dirt and stains arise in that mirror?”

original: “Na hi, bhante, aññadatthu vimalataraṁyeva bhaveyyā”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhante aññadatthu vimalatarayā iva bhaveyya ati
translated: “No, revered sir, it would be all the more clear and bright.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, jinasāsanavaraṁ pakatinimmalaṁ byapagatakilesamalarajojallaṁ,🔽yadi taṁ buddhaputtā ācārasīlaguṇavattapaṭipattisallekhadhutaguṇena jinasāsanavaraṁ
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja jina sāsana varam pakati nimmalam byapagata kilesa mala rajaḥ jalla  yadi tam buddha puttāḥ ācāra sīla guṇavatta paṭipatti sallekha dhuta guṇena jina sāsana vara
translated: “Even so, sire, the excellent Dispensation of the Conqueror is naturally pure, free from the dust and dirt of the defilements,

original: sallakkheyyuṁ, evamidaṁ jinasāsanavaraṁ ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭheyya, asuñño ca🔽loko arahantehi assāti imamatthaṁ bhagavatā sandhāya bhāsitaṁ ‘ime ca, subhadda,
analyzed: sallakkheyyu evam idam jina sāsana varam ciram dīgham addhānam tiṭṭheyya asuñño ca  lokaḥ arahantehi assa ati imam attham bhagavatā sandhāya bhāsitam ime ca subhadda
translated: but if the sons of the Buddha were to examine the excellent Dispensation of the Conqueror by the practice of good conduct, virtue, the qualities of character, the practice of the duties, the rules of the Order, and the ascetic qualities,

original: bhikkhū sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assā’ti.
analyzed: bhikkhū sammā vihareyyu asuññaḥ loko arahantehi assa āti
translated: then this excellent Dispensation of the Conqueror would last long, and the world would not be empty of Arahants. This is the meaning of the words spoken by the Blessed One: ‘If these bhikkhus, Subhadda, were to conduct themselves properly, the world would not be empty of Arahants.’

original: Paṭipattimūlakaṁ, mahārāja, satthusāsanaṁ paṭipattikāraṇaṁ paṭipattiyā anantarahitāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
analyzed: paṭipatti mūlaka mahā rāja satthu sāsanam paṭipatti kāraṇam paṭipattiyāḥ anantara hitāya tiṭṭhati iti
translated: The Dispensation of the Master, sire, which is based on practice, lasts because of practice, and it does not disappear as long as practice does not disappear.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘saddhammantaradhānan’ti yaṁ vadesi, katamaṁ taṁ saddhammantaradhānan”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena saddhamma antaradhānam iti yam vadesi katamam tam saddhamma antaradhānam iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you speak of the disappearance of the True Dhamma, what is this disappearance of the True Dhamma?”

original: “Tīṇimāni, mahārāja, sāsanantaradhānāni.
analyzed: tīṇi imāni mahā rāja
translated: “There are three kinds of disappearance of the Dispensation, sire.

original: Katamāni tīṇi?
analyzed: katamāni tīṇi
translated: What are the three?

original: Adhigamantaradhānaṁ paṭipattantaradhānaṁ liṅgantaradhānaṁ, adhigame, mahārāja, antarahite
analyzed: adhigama antara dhānam paṭipatta antara dhānam liṅga antara dhāna adhigame mahā rāja anta rahite
translated: The disappearance of the attainment, the disappearance of the practice, the disappearance of the sign. When the attainment has disappeared,

original: suppaṭipannassāpi dhammābhisamayo na hoti, paṭipattiyā antarahitāya sikkhāpadapaññatti
analyzed: suppaṭipannassa api dhamma abhisamayaḥ na hoti paṭipattiyā antarahitāya sikkhāpada paññatti
translated: even one who is well practiced does not attain the penetration of the Dhamma. When the practice has disappeared, the announcement of the training rule

original: antaradhāyati, liṅgaṁyeva tiṭṭhati, liṅge antarahite paveṇupacchedo hoti, imāni kho,
analyzed: antaradhāyati liṅgayā iva tiṭṭhati liṅge antarahite paveṇu pacchedaḥ hoti imāni kho
translated: disappears. Only the sign remains. When the sign has disappeared, the lineage is cut off. These,

original: mahārāja, tīṇi antaradhānānī”ti.
analyzed: mahā rāja tīṇi antaradhānāni iti
translated: great king, are the three disappearances.”

original: “Suviññāpito, bhante nāgasena, pañho, gambhīro uttānīkato, gaṇṭhi bhinno, naṭṭhā paravādā bhaggā nippabhā katā, tvaṁ gaṇivaravasabhamāsajjā”ti.
analyzed: su viññāpitaḥ bhante nāgasena pañhaḥ gambhīraḥ uttānīkataḥ gaṇṭhi bhinnaḥ naṭṭhā paravādā bhaggā nippabhā katā tvam gaṇi vara vasabham āsajja ati
translated: “The question has been well analyzed, revered Nāgasena, the deep has been made clear, the knot has been untied, the opponent’s view has been destroyed, the opponent’s view has been shattered and deprived of splendor, you have defeated the opponent’s view.”
